channel.title: Two people coding one RSPS?
channel.description: So I'm wondering how two people can code one server? It just seems a pain if one person has to code then send the second person the file every time.

item.title: Two people coding one RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:549050”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=667959.msg4467399#msg4467399 date=1420935451]

And if you want to keep your work private, use BitBucket instead of GitHub.

Or buy a github key for like $8 a month and get 3 private repos.

Or just use BitBucket and get unlimited private repos??

What are the pro’s of BitBucket you don’t get from Github. Besides the one obviously listed feature of private repo’s.

Never said bitbucket is better. Just said free private repos would be my go-to if I made a server rather than spending $8
[/quote]
I was just asking if there are any other pros to it that Git doesn’t have.[/quote]BitBucket uses Git lol

Read full topic

item.title: Two people coding one RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Coldmedicine:

We just use a VPS…

Doesn’t mean shit?
Github is for version/content control. your VPS is used to host your server/website/whatever.
You can use github to push updates to the VPS. And you wouldn’t even have to send the entire server over to the VPS over and over. All you do is sync the VPS to the github and boom, anything you changed is updated. Anything you didn’t stays the same (Why update something that didn’t have any change?).
The way you’re doing it now is probably either A) Zipping the source and then downloading it on the VPS (Via dropbox, mediafire, whatever) or B) Working on the VPS itself (You’re an idiot if you do this. Never do this). And both have huge disadvantages. As I previously stated, why constantly download the exact same, unchanged, files when you only need the updated ones. How about if one of your updated files replaces an old one and causes a huge exploit. But wait, you don’t know what file it’s in since you have no way to track your changes. Or, if you’re actually writing code on the VPS, what if you save your changes, cause an error, and then forget where the error is (or don’t know how to solve it). Your server will be S.O.L until you fix it, and you can bet players will hate that.

TL;DR:
Your method is wrong, use GIT or similar.

Read full topic

item.title: Two people coding one RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

You should use GIT even if you are one person working on the project. The ability to go back to previous versions is gold.

Read full topic

item.title: Two people coding one RSPS?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:7, topic:549050”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=667959.msg4467151#msg4467151 date=1420763422]
As everyone said. Github.
You can still use dropbox for minor things, but for working on the server/client code you should use Github or similar (there are other alternatives).

Github offers a windows client for those who don’t really understand the terminal. https://windows.github.com/
[/quote]
I’ve never used Github, but I am curious to how it is advantageous in this situation.[/quote]
https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,543969.0.html
